boardgame.name: Feywild Spring
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Three giant trees loom tall over this colorful Fey forest. The grass is lush and sparkles over rocky knolls, while leafy bushes form dense undergrowth. Razor grass with yellow-orange flowers bloom, while daisies creep across the ground.

Large stone outcrops rise upwards, with moss-covered rubble forming piles around their base and an ancient stone seal sits where a waterfall has formed a basin.

boardgame.name: Grove of the Three
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Three giant trees loom tall over this verdant green forest. The grass is lush and green over rocky knolls, while leafy bushes form dense undergrowth. Razor grass with red flowers bloom, while white daisies creep across the ground.

Large stone outcrops rise upwards, with moss-covered rubble forming piles around their base.

boardgame.name: Trackless Fens Blossoming Gully
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Puddles of fetid water lay stagnant over thick mud in these fens, while bugs swarm around bushes and dying trees. A small stream fills the stinking pools, flowing in from a steep cliff before slowing to a halt in the marshes below.

The stench of rotting decay rises from the oozing mud and strange, blossoming undergrowth. Roots from trees reach out of the mud like clawing hands, grasping for sunlight they haven’t seen in years…

boardgame.name: Lava Fjords Bridges
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Embers rise in sizzling waves of heat from the pools of lava below, breezing past bridges dangling precariously above. The magma flows in from a volcano somewhere higher above, running down in rivulets between rocky stone outcrops.

Blackened and scorched boulders are illuminated eerily in the red light, rubble forming mounds at their base. They form partial cliffs as they overlook this fjord of lava.

boardgame.name: GRID Legends
boardgame.description: GRID Legends is a high-stakes driving experience that combines thrilling motorsport action, incredible race variety and an immersive story that puts the player at the heart of the action.
boardgame.videogameversion: North American Xbox Series X edition

boardgame.name: Dead Space (2022)
boardgame.description: The sci-fi survival horror classic Dead Space returns, completely rebuilt from the ground up by Motive Studios to offer a deeper and more immersive experience. Harnessing the power of the Frostbite game engine and next generation consoles, this remake brings jaw-dropping visual fidelity and improvements to gameplay while staying true to the original.

boardgame.name: Rund um die Erde
boardgame.description:
The players start at space 1 in Hamburg. The first to reach space 80 wins the game. Movement is determined by a spinner in the center of the game board. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

This game was published about 1903.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Auteur
boardgame.description:
Auteur is a highly thematic Economic-Strategy board game, about managing a movie-production studio, with Worker Placement with different workers elements and a unique Bumping mechanism.

In the game, players are the Film-makers (Auteur) of an inchoate movie Studio that, during the 5 rounds the game lasts, try to make their studio the most successful there is!

To achieve this, players hire Stars (Actors, Directors, Writers) and try to raise their fame. They gather crew, special guests and extras, upgrade their studio facilities, try to fund through sponsors and bank, promo their movies, and do everything they can, in order to produce their Films.
To have their films premiered, they shall get through the five movie-production stages, during which they get evaluated (earn Prestige/Victory points). Meanwhile they try to follow the hype, fulfill their agendas, and generally do whatever they can to be in the Spotlight.

Sometimes they manage to even win awards, but that's a hard thing to do....By the end, the one who managed to get the most out of their studio, is the winner!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Shield of Achilles
boardgame.description:
The war at Troy has been waging for 10 years now. Achilles, hero of the greeks prepares to avenge his dear friend Patroclus. In order to do so, Achilles' mother, the goddess Thetis ask the help of Hephaestus (you), blacksmith of the gods to create a new shield for him.

During the course of the game, you will craft the famous shield depicting scenes of ancient greek life. Your objective is to score more points by crafting the shield than the points on your discarded dice by the end of the game. These discarded dice values represent the scrap metal that Apollo steals away from you to create arrows for Paris, who is destined to kill Achilles.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Bats of Saint Abbans - Book 2 Adventure
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The once-respected Abbey-Cathedral of Saint Abbans has stood at the top of Wellholy Hill for centuries.

Revenue is scarce and the abbey is falling into disrepair. To make matters worse, church bats have now infested the upper reaches of the building. They are causing a dangerous nuisance and further damaging the precarious structure.

Abbess Jessamine is looking for brave souls without fear of heights to ascend the cavernous cathedral and bring the problem under control.

Maybe, just maybe, that’s you?

boardgame.name: Monster Hunts Weekly: Issue 26
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Monster Hunts Weekly presents a collection of one-shot adventures, full color maps, new creatures, magical items, plot hooks and harvest tables to quickly inject into your Dungeons and Dragons games!
...
The Triple-A
New Harvesting Materials
6 New Magical Items To Craft
4 Plot Hooks
Armed and Dangerous (APL 6-7)

boardgame.name: Nase vorn
boardgame.description:
In this game, published by Deutsche Bahn and produced by Ravensburger, players travel within Germany by train, car or plane (and have to pay the costs).
Players choose different modes of transportation to reach their destination as quickly as possible. For reaching the destinations, players receive points that they are allowed to drag forward on the time path. The sooner a player arrives at the destination, the more additional time points he wins. If a player runs out of money, he can spend time to earn some more bucks. The game ends after 6 trips. The winner is the player who is ahead on the time path.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Aloysius' Guide to Social Acceptance
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Aloysius' Guide to Social Acceptance is a personal passion project to showcase creatures all throughout Dungeon and Dragon's history and allow it's readers the ability to make player characters with such creatures from all across Faerun. Volume 1 will contain old and new races that seasoned adventurers and newcomers to Dungeons and Dragons may have heard of or seen from a glance. If a race has made it's presence known within the Inner Circle of the Great Wheel, then Volume 1 will serve you well in making unforgettable characters. Nearly every bit of content in Aloysius is geared to be Faerun friendly and contain brand new artwork from a large host of artists.

boardgame.name: Van Richten's Treatise on Lycanthropy
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Werebeasts beware! Van Richten's Treatise on Lycanthropy revolutionizes the werebeast's curse like never before!
...

Van Richten's Notes. The supplement includes an in-game guide to lycanthropy written by the esteemed monster hunter Rudolph van Richten himself. This guide can be given directly to your players (and found by their characters) without the worry of metagaming or spoilers. Beware, however, for Van Richten is only human, and though his expertise is unparalleled, the scholar is still fallible!



New Lycanthropy Rules. Gone are the messy rules of lycanthropy. With clear instructions on how the affliction is spread and cured, and how it affects its victims, you can run the disease for both PCs and NPCs alike.



New Player Options. Was your character infected with lycanthropy or born with the affliction? With a new ancestry option, and five racial feats, you can kit out your own true lycanthrope PC.



New Werebeast Phenotypes. Face the ravenous werecrocodile or battle the dreaded werewalrus! This supplement features six new lycanthrope phenotypes, in addition to the werebat and wereraven of other official sources. Van Richten's adds werecats (lions, cheetahs, and jaguars, oh my), werecrocodiles, werefoxes, werehyenas, wereserpents, weresharks, and, of course, werewalruses.



New Werebeast Statistics. Bored of a mere werewolf? With over thirty variant statbolcks, you can hurl werewolf alphas, wererat masterminds, and more at your players. However, no werebeast is as fearsome as the apex—a lycanthrope of legendary strength and resilience, born out of dark and unnatural means. Of these terrifying beasts, the CR 15 Werewolf Apex reigns supreme.



New Items. Five new magic items and a litany of other tools that no lycanthrope hunter should leave home without!

boardgame.name: Kobold Craziness Part 1: Ice to Mead You
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

When two elves disappear while delivering mead to Easthaven, the Mead merchants of Good Mead suspect the worst. That mead absolutely needs to be delivered! And sure, they want the elves saved too… if it’s possible.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 1.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: The Goblin Bathwater Incident
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Goblin Bathwater, a magical drug, has taken hold in a sleepy coastal town at the edge of the Empire. As the characters investigate the origin of the drug, they uncover an international criminal conspiracy, wild and ancient magic, and a threat to reality itself.

boardgame.name: ¡Ay, Corona!
boardgame.description:
In this fun card game you try to survive the corona pandemic together. Or everyone just looks after themselves.

In chaotic game rounds you switch cards back and forth and try to avoid the virus. Collect toilet paper, become a conspiracy theorist and determine national strategies.

The goal of the game is simple: survive! There are two ways the game ends: either there is only one surviving player left or all cards have been drawn at which point the pandemic is over.

In each round you have to first draw a card and then play an action card. If you pickup a virus card, you're infected and can potentially die. Every players has a risk value that increases by picking up negative status cards. From time to time all infected players have to roll their dice to see if they die. The lower your risk value the higher your chance to survive.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Emergency Broadcast
boardgame.description:
In Emergency Broadcast, players act as first responders on a mission to secure resources for the residents of their community. Over three rounds, floodwaters rise becoming more treacherous and leaving less available land and resources. The winner is the player who best meets their rescue objectives and earns the most points after three stormy rounds.

Each round, players are dealt three objective cards, of which they must choose two objectives they wish to work toward during the round.

Turn Order:

LAY A TILE – lay a resource tile on the board.
EXCHANGE A TILE – If desired, you may exchange a tile from your hand for a new tile.
SCORE AN OBJECTIVE CARD – If you choose, you may score one of your two objective cards.
MOVE THE FIRST RESPONDER MEEPLE – place the first responder meeple on top of the tile just played. This prevents the next player from immediately sabotaging your resources.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Crystallized
boardgame.description:
Experience the eye-bending effect of Crystallized! In Crystallized, players will match up colors on the hexagonal cards in their hand with those already played in the play area. Once the color or colors have been matched up, the player will deposit the appropriate number of crystals to the facet board. If a player makes a match with a card that scores more than enough to fill the facet board with that color, they may take the leftover crystals, and dump them on an opponent – as long as that player has at least one of that color in their collection. They are stuck with those unwanted crystals for the rest of the game. Don’t forget that cards can also be built on top of other cards within the play area, making the game even more complex and challenging. The game is made up of high-quality components that feature a satisfying tactile experience. The beautiful, jewel-colored crystals along with the beautifully designed hexagonal cards make up a gorgeous, abstract play area that’s different each time. Crystallized is easy to learn and play, but can be as challenging as each player’s mind desires.


THE GOAL IS SIMPLE: Deposit as many crystals as you can to the communal facet board by matching up colors on the hexagonal cards in your hand.
HOW TO PLAY: Deposit crystals to the facet board by matching colors on a card in your hand with a card already played on the play area. The more colors you match, the more crystals you can add.
STICK YOUR OPPONENTS: When you fill a facet board, you have the opportunity to stick other players with unwanted crystals.
END GAME: The game ends when the facet board is full of crystals.
WIN by having the fewest crystals in your collection at the end of the game.
EASY TO LEARN, DIFFICULT TO MASTER: Crystallized is easy to learn to play, but can be as challenging as each player would like it to be.
HIGH QUALITY COMPONENTS: Players will enjoy this beautifully crafted game with highly satisfying tactile elements.
FUN FOR EVERYONE: Families or Friends: 2-4 players, ages 8-99. Plays in 20 minutes. You will want to play again and again.


—description from the publisher

9 new Cards: Miller and Baker; Hatter; Acquisitor (x2); Spooner; Glover; Naylor
3 new Developments: Aqueduct; Pier; Monastery
2 new Countess Event cards (for base game solo mode): Bring It On! and Gambit
2 new Countess Mode Helper cards: Burglar; Spy
4 new Events: Youths; Quality Goods; Guilds; Heavy Snows

This pack was made available for free to backers of the Villagers: Shifting Seasons Kickstarter, and it will be made available to purchase directly from Sinister Fish while stocks last.

boardgame.name: Home Builder
boardgame.description:
You and an opponent are engaged in a friendly competition for the title “Greatest Home Builder” in the Tri-Valley area. To win, you’ll have to successfully assemble all the components needed to build the best houses: Lots, Financing, an Architect and Materials. You’ll also need to add some custom features that buyers want, such as a swimming pool or sun deck.

During the game, you’ll compete for the above components and features by playing hands of 3-card poker. However, since this is a friendly competition, the “pots” are not winner-take-all. Instead, the winner of a round will gain two components, while his/her opponent will gain one – and it’s the winner’s decision. Close attention to your needs and your opponent’s needs is required. Your goal is, ideally, to build each house with the same level of components: fair, good, better, best; this is not always easy. Additionally, land in the Tri-Valley is a bit scarce, so you’re limited to five housing starts. Also, card management in the form of “what to play now and what to save for later” is an important factor in winning the game.

This is the second game in a series using the 3CP Game Engine, which employs custom cards and a deck of standard playing cards.


Print & Play cards available in Files section.
Professionally produced card deck available at thegamecrafter.com SOON.

boardgame.name: 24 Ways an Artifact Can Kill
boardgame.description:
You examine the ancient device, transfixed by it's smooth exterior and bright lights. You press a button hoping to discover it's secrets -- only for your life to flash before your eyes.

This d24 table for science fiction and post-apocalyptic games details potential ways messing with ancient and unknown technology can lead to PCs' demise.

boardgame.name: Agon Stretch Goal Islands
boardgame.description:
User Note: Combined PDF of all of the Islands promised as stretch goals for the Agon Kickstarter. As of July 26, 2021, it seems to be only available to Kickstarter backers. Introductions for each island below:

Agrios - Jeeyon Shim
Agrios, Hekate’s playground, hosts a tapestry of thick cypress forests that shelter a mysterious abundance of flora and fauna. To desecrate Agrios is to desecrate Hekate herself, and should any fool make such a misstep the land herself will swallow the heretic in her jaws.

Aplestia - Ben Scerri
Aplestia is an isle of rolling hills crisscrossed with limestone tunnels and covered everywhere with blossoms of every color on Iris’s mantle. There are some that claim in the warrens beneath the island, there are doorways to every corner of the world.

Gorgona - Whitney Delagio
An island not made of sand and earth, but the wreckage and torn canvases of once proud ships. The populace that resides here have tendrils instead of human legs, and claim to be descendants of the legendary Kraken.

Kelades - Kira Magrann
The Kelades are a chain of tropical islands dense with jungle and idyllic beaches. Sailors sing of Centaurs and other deadly beasts living here in the wilds. The songs say there are circular jungles that spit travelers back out to the same shores, some mystical barrier preventing further entry.

Khryse - James Mendez Hodes
Khryse is a half-sunk ancient city’s acropolis, its pale towers piercing upward out of briny canals or hilltop streets. Braided vines wind around them, fruit trees and flowers growing through windows or upon rooftop earth-mounds. The ruins form echoing theaters which amplify duelists’ scathing voices as they battle with verse or dance in the gods’ names.

Ophanos - Stras Acimovic
The island of Ophanos is sizable and not well known. It’s covered in forests, and natural majesty, and is mostly populated by centaurs, dryads and the like.

Persephone's Garden - Misha Bushyager
The island is a riot of color. Jewel tones dominate with flowers and fruit laden trees as far as the eye can see. Upon closer examination, the fruit and flowers are made of intricately carved precious stones, a fortune’s worth dedicated to giving Persephone a place that reminds her of the spring she so loves. Five fountains bubble along the shore, including one filled with fire and one wailing if you listen. Around the edges of the island, the lushness of the landscape changes to withered plants and dead leaves.

Skiá - Allison Arth
Ruled by rival twin queens, Skiá is an island divided. A central volcanic ridge — renowned for rich gemstone deposits, and rumored as a titan’s lair — separates lush forests and golden beaches from bluish haze and rocky shores.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Go Green
boardgame.description:
It's time to go green! In the Monopoly: Go Green Edition board game, players buy, sell, and trade properties, and invest in greening them up. Build wooden greenhouses to collect more rent and invest in solar and wind utilities. In this edition of the Monopoly game, greenhouses and dice are made of FSC certified wood from well-managed forests, and tokens are made with plant-based plastic derived from sugarcane, a renewable raw material. The package, gameboard, game guide, money, cards, storage bag, insert, and money tray are made with 100% recycled paper.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Huarikasaya Kalatakaya!: The battle of Strongest, Bolivia vs Paraguay, May 1934.
boardgame.description:
Huarikasaya Kalatakaya! is a two player print and play, free mini game (140 counters and 11" x 8,5" map) simulating the climactic battle of Strongest during the Chaco War between Bolivia and Paraguay.

The simulation is at battalion level and play is done in an hexagonal grid map with hexes spanning 1 mile from side to side; each turn is one day of battle.

Special features of the battle as limited command and control, intelligence gathering and severe thirst are all included in the rules set.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Cryptid: Leggende Urbane
Cryptid: Urban Legends
boardgame.description:
There's something hiding among us, a creature hitherto undiscovered prowling our very streets. If you track it down, well, that'd be the discovery of the century!

Play as a determined scientist manipulating heat, movement, and sonic sensors to scan the city, identify your quarry's true location, and capture them — or take the role of a cryptid, snaking your way through shadows and back alleys of the metropolis that surrounds you, eliminating all evidence of your existence as you go, desperately avoiding capture. Emerging victorious in this high stakes cat-and-mouse chase, played out across a sprawling urban landscape, will require all your ingenuity and foresight.

Cryptid: Urban Legends is a tense asymmetric game of competitive abstract deduction for two players from the creators of Cryptid.

boardgame.name: Legends of Oz: Dorothy's Return
boardgame.description:
Legends of Oz: Dorothy's Return is a puzzle game, based on the musical and adventure books by Roger Stanton Baum, the great-grandson of L. Frank Baum.

Legends of Oz finds Dorothy waking to post-tornado Kansas, only to be whisked back to Oz to try to save her old friends the Scarecrow, the Lion, the Tin Man and Glinda from a devious new villain, the Jester.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: アブダク‼ (Abduction!!)
boardgame.description:
アブダク‼ ("Abduction!!") is a small box card game in which players are aliens with orders to abduct a creature known as Ushisan ("cow") from the distant planet Chikyū ("Earth"). Abduction can only be done once, though, so make sure you have the right cow!

Players are each dealt a hand of cards and one command card. Players have two options on their turn: play a card in the field or declare "abduction!" and collect cards from the field to get out of the round.

If you play a card in the field, you need to match the colors or numbers of the adjacent cards vertically and horizontally, or match the colors with multicolored cards. If you declare "abduction!", you can select one row vertically and horizontally and collect up to 5 cards from the edge. You can only abduct once, then you are out of the round.

Abducted cards that match the color of the command card will be scored, and leftover cards in hand will be negative points.

boardgame.name: Critical Care: The Game
boardgame.description:
Critical Care: The Game lets you bring all of the intensity and teamwork of the ICU to life on your kitchen table. Designed by an ICU doctor, the Critical Care is based in real medicine but accessible for a broad audience.

Featuring:

Cooperative gameplay for 1-4 players taking on the role of ICU doctors; discharge all of your patients to win, but beware the threat of a Code Blue that can end the game for everyone!
No medical knowledge required- but each of over 250 unique cards has a plain-English description of real ICU medicine
Select from 8 unique patients and 25 ICU Diagnoses such as Sepsis; patients are at risk for 50 unique Complications, allowing for endless replay value as the game builds on these combinations
Heal patients and recover with over 100 unique Therapy cards, everything from potent medications to invasive procedures
Bring in additional expertise with over 20 unique Specialists like the Cardiologist or Pharmacist to turn the tide in your favor
Watch out - your pager goes off every turn. A 2am consult from the Emergency Room can throw off your best plans!


Gameplay
Each day in the ICU, the game's engine tries to add Injury and Crisis tokens to patients and players race to remove these tokens. Each patient can sustain Injury to five different systems: brain, heart, lung, blood, and inflammation. In addition, each patient has a Crisis track representing the intangibles of being sick in the hospital: how much the patient is suffering and how close they are to death. As Crisis tokens accumulate, patients are more likely to develop complications. If all available slots for injury tokens or the Crisis Track are filled, the patient undergoes a Code Blue and the team has a chance to work together to save the patient or else the game is lost.

The game is played over a week: seven Days in the ICU. Each Day is broken up into several phases. First, Rounding and Complications happen simultaneously for all players; during Rounding, any cards already on the patient take effect, adding or removing Injury and Crisis. Then, Complications are drawn for each patient; the injury they have already sustained determines what Complications they get, just like in real life! After Rounding and Complications, players take individual turns called Shifts. During each Shift, a player draws and resolves a Pager card and then draws up to 7 Therapy cards and plays up to 12 hours of Therapies. Pager cards represent real life in the hospital, such as when nursing is short-staffed or the CT scanner breaks down. Therapy cards have beneficial effects for patients, often removing Injury or Crisis tokens. Many instantly remove Injury/Crisis; tokens removed this way are added to your experience pool, which may be used for a variety of purposes including bringing in consulting Specialists in the next phase. In the Specialist Phase, players pool experience tokens to consult Specialists and bring them into the ICU. Specialists have active and passive abilities to bend the rules in your favor; for example, the Surgeon prevents complications from invasive procedures. After the Specialist phase, the Day counter is advanced and the phases repeat, starting with Rounding, until either all patients are cured & discharged from the ICU (win), patients survive until the end of Day Seven (win), or any patient dies (lose).

Critical Care is brought to you by a diverse team of doctors, board game designers, experts in patient language & graphic design, artists, and writers as well as a phenomenal team of sensitivity reviewers who bring in an additional focus on health equity and the patient & family experience of the intensive care unit. We hope Critical Care gives you an immersive experience of the ICU that is fun and authentic but never disrespectful.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Logitech Attack 3
boardgame.description:
This is an analog two-axis joystick with analog slider and total of 11 digital buttons.
Analog slider is placed at the center of the joystick base facing the user. There are one rather large trigger button, four thump operated buttons on the top of the stick and six button on the joystick base, two each side of the stick: left, back and right.
This joystick uses an USB interface.
Model number is J-UJ18.

boardgame.name: Cryptodome
boardgame.description:
Cryptodome is the most popular game show set in a future where technology has exploded in countless directions. Salvagers find creative ways to use these technologies to build upon their suits to help navigate an underground magma chamber on Planet Varcob. Play as a salvager, each with a unique ability, as you make your way around the Cryptodome.

The object of the game is to be the first to collect three Power Cores that are located around the outside of the board. Players start at the center and use move cards to make their way to one of the outer edges of the board to collect an artifact or power core. Once collected it's kept for the remainder of the game and the player is teleported back to the start. Artifacts give powerful abilities, but do not contribute to winning the game.

Players get to choose two actions for their turn. They can choose any combination of placing a tile, using a move, and/or drawing a card. Placing a tile allows players to change the path to their advantage or to block their opponents. Using a move can only be done if the corresponding paths are connected. Drawing a card can result in a move card or an ability card.

Cryptodome is a free-for-all game for 2-8 players ages 14 and up that can be played in about an hour. Three types of cards allows for a simple risk/reward system that players can strategize with as the game goes on. Games change in dynamic based on the number of players and the strategies that players tend towards. Players tend to collect up to two artifacts near the beginning of the game and then use them to collect three power cores more effectively.

Kickstarter pre-launch page is up! Follow here for all the updates!
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/jacobvarrogames/cryptod...

Issue 549
August 2021
Ignorable Theme: Have you ever had a PC (or NPC) who was trying to Do at least one Good Deed a day or at least one Evil Deed a day? How did it work out?

boardgame.name: Ninja Knights
boardgame.description:
In the time of war during the Sengoku period in Japan, four clans vie for control of Sakura Village from its brutal leader, Lord Ishihara.

Ninja Knights is a deck-building action-adventure game. Each player plays as a ninja from one of the competing dojos. The ninja use their decks to control all their actions and complete missions toward victory. They scramble through the random village tiles teeming with enemy samurai and guards. By building up and increasing power with items and ability cards, the ninja race to spy, rescue, and assassinate.

Sneaking and Combat is done by building up combos within the player’s hand.

The enemy actions are controlled by a cube-pull system, which keeps players on their toes. The guards and samurai are constantly moving throughout the village. A simple guard may carry the heart of a lion. While a samurai could easily become something even worse!

Purchasing the many different items from the shops and upgrades from the temple and shrine allow each ninja to focus on their own style. Plus, completed mission cards join the player’s deck for a greater bonus and more buying power.

Ninja Knights uses a streamlined A.I. Ninja that fights to complete missions herself. This evil ninja allows solo play or she can add an extra challenger in two player games.

Components included:

1 Rulebook

90 Poker Cards

16 4”x 4" Boards

12 Blue tokens

14 Red tokens

4 White tokens

12 Yellow tokens

2 Eight-sided Dice

1 Compass Die

2 Green markers

2 Orange markers

2 White markers

3 Ninja Meeples

2 Clear Markers

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hold the Line: Excalibur, The Battles of King Arthur
boardgame.description:
This game takes the myths, legends, and history to tell the tale of Arthur and his battles as they might have been.

Now you get to refight the battles that were or might have been using an updated and deepened Hold the Line system....

The game comes with 3 campaigns of linked scenarios, with 8 total scenarios:

Campaign 1: SCENARIOS 1 - 3 “THE MATTER OF THE NORTH” (Roughly 490 AD)
Campaign 2: SCENARIOS 4 - 6 “PEACE OR NONE” *Roughly 10 years later (Around 500 AD)
Campaign 3: SCENARIOS 7 - 8 “THE WINTER OF THE KING”

Scenario 1: The River Glein
Scenario 2: Old Trimontium
Scenario 3: Cat Coit Caledon
Scenario 4: A Sleepy Village
Scenario 5: The Outskirts of Londinium
Scenario 6: The Battle of Badon Hill
Scenario 7: Treachery at the Stables
Scenario 8: The Battle of Camlann

Anyone familiar with the HOLD THE LINE system will quickly pick up the changes.

DETERMINE ACTION POINTS (AP): In each scenario each side in a turn is given a set number of action points (normally 3 to 5), and then roll a die to receive a random number from 1 to 3 of additional action points.

SIDE A PERFORMS ACTIONS: The currently active player spends up to his total action points performing the following actions with individual units. Each unit must complete it's action before the next unit begins it's actions:

1 AP - Activate a unit to move up to its movement allowance
1 AP - Move or attack using 2 adjacent Coastal Raider units
1 AP - Attack an adjacent unit
1 AP - Leaders may rally 1 hit on a unit they are stacked with
2 AP - Cavalry type units may perform a cavalry charge against non-adjacent enemy units
2 AP - Gesith infantry units may move 1 hex and attack enemy units
2 AP - Berserkers may perform a berserker charge
2 AP - Pictish Chieftains may cavalry charge enemy infantry type units only
After Side A spends all of the Action Points he has available, or passes, then Side B Performs Actions.

After Side B spends all of the Action Points he has available, or passes, the Victory is checked. If neither side has won a victory, and it is not the last turn of the game, then a new turn begins.

Some of the highlighted system changes are:

Greater unit differentiation in hit/combat ability
Special Leader Abilities
Coastal Raiders group movement and combat
Berserkers
Cavalry Charges
3 Armies - Romano-British/ Saxons/ Picts
Optional Rules for Merlin and Morganna with special magical abilities

Victory is determined by eliminating opposing units and capturing terrain

boardgame.name: ARCHINT
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

ARCHEOLOGICAL INTELLIGENCE

Some analysts develop signals intelligence or SIGINT. Some develop human intelligence, HUMINT. Delta Green deals in older secrets. It needs ARCHINT: a study of appalling dangers left in hidden places. It needs agents to look into horrors so that others can turn away. Agents like yours. ARCHINT is playable with Delta Green: The Role-Playing Game.

The Amulet of the Ai-Apa
Blood of the Feeder
The Brixton Shard
The Eggs of Apep
The Gowdie Shape
The Hunahp* Mask
The Kurville Executable
The Miranov Object
The Reneteur Device
The Stone of Yos
Sweet Lady Blood Pruner

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Captain America & War Machine
boardgame.description:
After the super-soldier serum wore off, Steve Rogers was restored to his natural age. Unable to battle any longer, he retired from the role of Captain America. Rogers chose Sam Wilson, one of his closest and most trusted allies, to take up the shield in his place. Wilson had already proved his commitment to protecting justice as the Avenger Falcon and continues to protect the vulnerable as Captain America.

Lieutenant Colonel James “Rhodey” Rhodes is War Machine, an armored Avenger and walking arsenal. As Tony Stark’s personal pilot and closest friend, Rhodes wears the Variable Threat Response Battle Suit, a suit of armor equipped with a variety of armaments including shoulder-mounted cannons, missile launchers, particle beams, repulsors, and more. War Machine combines his many years of experience as a Marine pilot with Tony Stark’s cutting-edge designs as an Avenger and symbol of mechanized might.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Բժշկությունն ԱՅԼ ԿԵՐՊ ( Another way Medical)
boardgame.description:
Բժշկությունն ԱՅԼ ԿԵՐՊ ("Another way Medical") is a team-based game where players have to guess words.
It is a thematic application of Այլ կերպ (Another way) game, designed for those who understand medicine, biology, human anatomy and healthcare.

Gameplay:
One player draws a card, explains to his teammates the 7 words written on the card one at a time, without using identical words nor the translation of that word into other languages.
Each guessed word is worth 1 point.
Only 1 minute is allowed.

The team with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Artisans of the Taj Mahal
boardgame.description:
Recruit craftspeople, construct the iconic mausoleum of the Taj Mahal and maintain the monument’s beautiful gardens. Erect towering domes, intricate minarets and enormous archways to earn the most points and be declared Master Architect!

Players choose how to best use shared dice on their individual print and play boards to construct their buildings. One die is used to determine the location and the other is used to determine a value. The value might need to be the same as the other rolls for that location, or the values might need to be in ascending order, or maybe the values all need to be even numbers. Players can individually manipulate dice values with raindrop powerups, but there are a limited number so they must be used wisely.

boardgame.name: Modern Art: Korean Artist Pack
모던 아트 - 한국 화가 카드와 시세 보드
boardgame.description:
A price board and art cards for Modern Art featuring works of classic Korean artists: 신사임당, 정선, 김홍도, 신윤복, 김정희. These replace the cards in the original game, but only to provide the alternate art. The content of the cards is the same.

NOTE: The Korean Artist Pack was included in the first printing of the DiceTree edition of Modern Art.

boardgame.name: Pocket Quiz: Kopfnüsse
boardgame.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with mental exercises. The backside of each card contains the solutions. Solve the exercises first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

This edition contains 150 questions, tasks, and puzzles about various topics.

The title translates to "Headbutts".

boardgame.name: Pocket Quiz: Verrückte Natur
boardgame.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information.

This edition contains 150 questions about the craziest
curiosities and records from nature. Amusement and amazement guaranteed!

The title translates to "Crazy Nature".

boardgame.name: That's the yellow from the egg
boardgame.description: "That's the yellow from the egg" is a card game about common phrases. If you translate German idioms into the English language you don't get the correct English equivalent, but rather a funny English sentence. Then it's not English, it's Denglish ("D" for Deutsch = German). So one by one the players draw a card and have to translate the Denglish sentences into German and then also have to find the correct English phrase. Only if a player can translate the Denglish phrase into German and then correctly into English they can keep the card. The more cards the players collect, the more points they earn. Whoever earns most points wins.

boardgame.name: Fernweh: Das Quiz der 100 Sehnsuchtsorte
boardgame.description:
This quiz about 100 exciting places in the world is full of fun, vacation mood and wanderlust. Whether alone or with friends, as inspiration for the next travel destination or to relax after a stressful day: With this quiz, a total of 100 spectacular cities, countries and sights can be discovered.

In addition to exciting quiz questions to puzzle over, the cards also contain informative texts to browse through. 15 of the total of 100 cards are designed as vacation postcards with incredible travel stories. It's up to you to decide: Is the story true or have false facts been added to the adventures? The beautiful vacation photos on all the cards make you feel as if you were right there in Iceland, Las Vergas or Bali.

The title of the game translates to "The quiz of 100 places of desire".

boardgame.name: Black Party: Dying at the Discotheque
boardgame.description:
In "Black Party" the players embody characters who are involved in a spectacular murder case. One of the players is the murderer. But the others also have their dirty secrets or a motive and each of them have an extra task that only they know.
The group decides by guessing and reconstructing the crime who is the murderer and afterwards the players see if the group was on the right track. So it's about getting away with life. Because what good is it to be innocent if the others think you are guilty?

In "Black Party - Dying at the Discotheque" the players are famous pop stars, hip artists, and corrupt politcians partying at a 1980s disco in New York City. They have to try to find out who murdered real estate tycoon by letting the giant disco ball crash down and hit him...

boardgame.name: Black Stories: Tödliche Party
boardgame.description:
It's party time - and anything can happen: Whether it's a night of drinking in a club, a graduation party, a New Year's Eve party, a bachelor party, a girls' night out, Father's Day or the infamous "Dorffest" - we love to celebrate wildly! And a lot can go wrong in the process: Highly embarrassing mishaps and crazy ideas that might end fatally...

How to play:
The card set contains 50 tricky, pitch-black puzzle cards for teens and adults to solve by asking clever questions. Cracking black stories together with friends is the most fun. One player, the bidder, takes a card from the deck, reads the short story written on the front of the card. On the back of the card, the master finds the answer, which he of course keeps to himself. Now the guessing people have to "ask" themselves the solution to the story. The questions should be formulated in such a way that the master can answer "yes" or "no". A spooky and fun guessing game for small and large groups - can also be played digitally.

boardgame.name: Picture Points
boardgame.description:
Everyone knows what a guitar looks like. But who can draw it roughly? Don't worry, this game doesn't require anyone to be a master painter. Here it's all about quick sketches and certain details that earn you points.

How to play:
One player draws a card and reads out a term. Each player draws it as detailed as possible within 30 seconds. Then the card is turned to the picture side and a schematic representation of the term becomes visible. The players get points for certain details. The player with the most points wins the game.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 3 bis 5 Spieler Spieldauer: 20 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 12+
Picture Points - Schnelles Zeichen- und Ratespiel Wie viele Saiten hat eine Gitarre und was ist alles auf einem 10-€-Schein zu sehen? Bei „Picture Points“ dreht sich alles darum, sich an genau solche Details innerhalb kurzer Zeit erinnern und diese zu Blatt zu bringen. Dabei spielt es keine Rolle, wie schön die Spieler*innen malen können. Wichtig ist stattdessen, besonders schnell möglichst genaue Skizzen mit vielen Details der gesuchten Begriffe anzufertigen. Denn nur für richtige Details gibt es Punkte – und wer die meisten Punkte hat, gewinnt. Das Zeichen- und Ratespiel lässt sich hervorragend in Gruppen spielen, auch kontaktlos am digitalen Spiele-Abend. Für jede Menge Spielspaß braucht es keine Meistermaler*innen, viel mehr sind ein schnelles Köpfchen und ein gutes Gedächtnis gefragt. Also: An die Stifte, fertig, los!
Und so wird’s gespielt: Ein/e Spieler*in zieht eine Karte und liest den gesuchten Begriff vor. Jede/r Spieler*in zeichnet ihn möglichst detailliert und innerhalb von 30 Sekunden. Anschließend wirddie Karte auf die Bildseite gedreht und eine schematische Darstellung des Begriffs wird sichtbar. Die Zeichnungen werden nun mit der Lösung verglichen: Für bestimmte Details bekommen die Spieler*innen unterschiedlich viele Plus- und Minuspunkte. Wer die meisten Punkte hat, gewinnt das Spiel.
Inhalt: - 50 Karten - 1 Block - 1 Anleitung
https://youtu.be/t_cDHVbYmuI
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.name: Lauschangriff
boardgame.description:
Players are asked to solve listening tasks based on any text read aloud. These tasks can be, for example:
Name a word heard in which a given letter occurs at the end of the word or identify the place where a grammatical case occurs. Whoever presses the buzzer first gets to name the answer. Correct answers earn plus points, wrong answers lose points. Whoever has the most points after the text has been read out wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Davoser-Spiel
boardgame.description: A Monopoly-like game with companies settled in Davos, Switzerland. There are some rule deviations, basically: no houses and hotels, start of sale of expensive land only after sale of all inexpensive land. Nevertheless, the game character of Monopoly is preserved.

boardgame.name: Das Riesen Bauernhofspiel
boardgame.description:
First, the game board is assembled from 35 puzzle pieces. Then each player chooses a plush animal. The player whose turn it is rolls the color die and may move to the next square of the same color. However, with red you have to move backwards and with white you have to sit out. The first player to reach the blue target field wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Lasst uns wandern
boardgame.description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 100 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The worst space is the one on which you realize, you've forgotten your cooking pot and are depending on the mercy of the other players.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Super Mission Force: Athwart Time
boardgame.description:
Super Mission Force: Athwart Time offers exciting new options for the Goalsystem game of fast and fun superhero skirmish battles! This supplement includes rules for solo and cooperative play, a complete mini-campaign, new character creation options, and new powers. Athwart Time also includes over a dozen stat profiles from the SuperFigs line of figures, giving you more great characters ready to hit the table for super action! You will need a copy of Super Mission Force 1st or 2nd edition to make the best use of this supplement.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: CreatorCrate
boardgame.description:
What is CreatorCrate?

You're the prototype for a brand new appliance, a 3d printer that can make ANYTHING. The only problem? You'd rather be free.

CreatorCrate is a viciously fast action platformer with roguelike elements. It's full of electrified death traps, terrifying murderbots, and passenger pigeons

Fast, Intense, and Challenging

Fight to stay alive while everything around you is on fire, exploding, or shooting lasers.

Dangle by your arm over deadly drops. Climb just ahead of fizzing pools of acid. Take it one area at a time with checkpoints or crank up the challenge with permadeath mode.

Procedural generation keeps the action fresh each time so you can get blown up and try again!

More than Run and Shoot

You improvise and create!

Think on your feet to outsmart complex systems of traps. Will you disable the security camera or avoid it by melting through the floor with acid? Will you dodge the hulking robot or throw a chair to lure it into a pit?

Stab the humans, hide from them, or carry them around as your special pets. There's always another solution to every challenge.

Grabby Tossy Chaos

With your grabby robot arm you throw people, block bullets with tables, swing from lamps, smash brooms into enemies, and devour anything not nailed down.

Snatch everything you can to stay alive as you scramble over machine gun turrets and flaming furniture.

Create Anything

It's great being an appliance that can make anything.

For instance: what if you need lots of guns, but all you have lying around is a few humans? EASY! Just use that useless biological matter to print out some handy-dandy firearms.

In need of repairs? Eat those guns and use their Matter to patch yourself up!

Lonely? JUST PRINT MORE HUMANS!

A word of warning: be careful when printing out some of the more complex biological blueprints. CreatorCrate gets them... mostly right.

A Breathtaking Circular World

Experience the wonder of a hard sci-fi setting rarely seen in games: a massive spinning space station.

Gravity shifts as you explore, from the freedom of low gravity acrobatics near the center to the terror of being brutally pulled into space at the outer edge. In Zero G, you float weightless, run on walls, and propel yourself with the recoil of firearms.

You can never trust your expectations in this labyrinth of curved floors and devious traps.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Concept: Demo-Minispiel
Concept: Litet Demospel
boardgame.description: A small demo version of the game Concept (2013).

boardgame.name: Shipwrecks
boardgame.description:
Double sided map of floating pieces of a hull broken on rocks, and a sunken ship between corals on the ocean floor.

24" x 30" unfolded, and 8" x 10" folded. The coated surface can be used with any dry erase, wet erase, or even permanent marker (which can also be erased).

boardgame.name: Escape Room: The Game – Family Edition: Time Travel
Escape Room: The Game – Family Edition: Viaje en el tiempo
boardgame.description:
Can you keep your cool under pressure? The escape room adventures ensures great fun and is an interesting change from conventional board games. As a family edition, it is ideal for the whole family

For approx. 195 minutes of fun - let yourself be carried away in three different time journeys (past, present, future - approx. 60 minutes each) and try to solve the exciting puzzles through real teamwork.

The Present

You just learned that your history teacher Professor Jura dedicates her private life to keeping the evil supervillain Doctor Quarks from taking over the city of Lockholm. Now things are getting serious and she needs your help, before Quarks attacks her secret lab. That leaves you only 60 minutes to fi nd that lab and fi gure out how to start the time machine.

The Past

There is a loud ‘POOF!’ and you see a sci-fi -like wormhole tunnel through the time machine window. You are supposed to meet Professor Jura in the past so you hope you will land in the right time. But what comes next? Does Jura know where to go to stop Quarks? You only have time crystal energy for another 60 minutes. So you better solve these questions quickly!

The Future

You land in Doctor Quark’s secret base in the future. Piece of cake! Or is it? Of course his guards spot you and lock you up right after your arrival. The countdown for his invasion has already started. 60 minutes for you to break out of your futuristic prison, find the way to his giant QuarksBot and disable it. Because if you don’t, Doctor Quarks will take control over Lockholm with his army of bots. You can do it!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Escape Room: The Game – Da Vinci's Telescope
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

listing.notes: Game weight: 0.920 kg

boardgame.name: Empires of the Void II: Meeple Source 60-Piece Upgrade Kit
boardgame.description:
This 60-piece set of silkscreened 24mm wooden discs for Empires of the Void II (by Red Raven Games) contains:

20 Cities
20 Bases
20 Academies

boardgame.name: Power Grid: Meeple Source 132-Piece Building Upgrade Kit
boardgame.description:
This upgrade kit for Power Grid contains 22 buildings in each of the 6 player colours. Each colour also has a unique shape and painted design, to aid colour-impaired players.

The approximate size of each piece is 13.5mm wide x 10.55mm thick x 12.5mm tall.

boardgame.name: Cake of Doom
boardgame.description:
Take over the world... with cakes!

Players compete to rule Earth by offering delicious bribes of cakes to its inhabitants. They must also watch out for any baking disasters from devious opponents. The first player to control enough regions will win.

A casual, light-hearted card game of cakes and aliens, Cake of Doom is perfect for non-gamers, casual groups, families, or as a palate cleanser for games night.

Let the bribery and sabotage begin!

boardgame.name: Namaste
boardgame.description:
For luck, you have to be clever - and fast - in this game. The Roll & Write game "Namaste" offers simple fun with lots of luck. Only those who cleverly enter the numbers rolled receive points. But be careful: If you take too long, you will quickly become the unlucky one, because then the field is left to the other players or you even collect minus points. If you want to win, you have to find the right balance between speed and strategy.

How it's played:
For each roll, all players enter numbers in ascending order. Each number may only appear once per row and column. In this way, the players gradually try to fill the rows and columns. If a player is the first to complete a row of numbers, they can write down the number in the middle as a point. The trick is: if you wait too long, you get fewer points or minus points. The player with the most "lucky points" wins.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 4 Spieler Spieldauer: 20 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 8+
Namaste - Würfelspiel Würfle dein Glück! Das clevere Roll & Write-Spiel „Namaste“ bietet einfachen Spielspaß mit jede Menge Glücksanteil. Tief durchatmen, denn nur wer die gewürfelten Zahlen geschickt einträgt, erhält Punkte. Doch Vorsicht: Wer zu lange braucht, überlässt seinen Mitspieler*innen das Feld oder sammelt gar Minuspunkte. Um zu gewinnen benötigt es die richtige Balance zwischen Schnelligkeit und Strategie. Das tolle Design des Spiels in Schwarz samt Details in knalligen Farben und die spirituellen Motive machen das Spiel zu einem wahren Hingucker und einem perfekten Geschenk für Spielefans.
So wird’s gespielt: Bei jedem Wurf tragen alle Spieler*innen Zahlen ein – und zwar in aufsteigender Reihenfolge. Jede Zahl darf pro Reihe und Spalte nur einmal vorkommen. So versuchen die Spieler*innen nach und nach die Reihen und Spalten zu füllen. Hat ein/e Spieler*in eine Zahlenreihe als Erster komplett, darf er/sie sich die Zahl aus der Mitte als Punkt notieren. Der Clou ist: Wer zu lange wartet, bekommt weniger Punkte oder Minuspunkte. Wer die meisten Glückspunkte hat, gewinnt.
Inhalt: 4 Würfel 1 Block 1 Spielanleitung
https://youtu.be/zyNi3JJY5iw
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.name: The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire – Meeple Source 95-Piece Upgrade Kit
boardgame.description:
This upgrade kit consists of 95 silkscreened wooden pieces for The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire (originally published by Minion Games). It includes:

54 Reversible Pollution Tokens (each token shows a Pollution symbol on the front and Nuclear Contamination on the back)
27 Scientific Research Tokens
12 Oil Well Tokens
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire – Cold War
The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire – Mexico
The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire – Missile Crisis

boardgame.name: Salto Wortale
boardgame.description:
Who can find all the solution words in the puzzle term? The communication game "Salto Wortale" offers 275 puzzles on 50 topics. The players have to fill out certain categories with words that are already contained in the puzzle term. The player who finds the most words the fastest wins. The game promotes language and is suitable for a non-contact, digital game evening.

How to play:
The players all receive the same sheet of paper. They have to find the words within long puzzle terms. The player who finds the most words gets the most points and wins.

boardgame.name: Unglorious
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Unglorious is an RPG that will allow you to play the role of an adventurer dead due to his carelessness and now resurrected in search of the glory he never got in life.

boardgame.name: Cronache della Cripta
boardgame.description:
User summary:
13 adventures for Unglorious RPG

boardgame.name: People's Soil
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Outer space can be stressful!

We are the People's Soil. We can relieve your stress.
Please consider picking up our free reading material.

In-world pamphlet recruiting converts for a distant space community. Compatible with the Mothership sci-fi horror RPG or suitable for any Sci-Fi RPG.


In-world pamphlet prop.
Includes haunting customer support audio prop.
Suitable as an adventure hook or fun handout.
List of supplements, "100% free from additives".


[*]For questions regarding perceived unexpected effects of our dietary supplements please call our Customer Support line.
To reach a family our loved one living at our compound, please leave a message after the tone - our members will appreciate your support.

boardgame.name: Codex R
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Codex R is a kaleidoscopic excursion in space-time, cataloging headless farmers, party deities, apocalyptic critters, bad hair days and totalitarian practices. Trade celebrity skins with collectors! Meet a friendly ambulatory building! Joust with carnivorous gastropods! Help lost souls find the best afterlife! Compatible with Troika! but fitting as inspiration for any fantasy game, it includes:


46 entries all with full color illustrations.
An illustrated mini adventure.
Table of events and adventure seeds.
Plenty of ideas ripe for your adventures.

boardgame.name: Accessible Gaming Quarterly (Year One - Jul 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Accessible Gaming Quarterly is the world's first zine devoted to accessibility and inclusion in the tabletop RPG industry. Each quarterly release features articles, essays, and art from disabled creators and allies.

Get the entire first year of Accessible Gaming Quarterly in one volume. That's four issues in one collection.

This anthology contains all the articles and art from AGQ Issues 1 through 4, conveniently packaged in a single tome. If you don't already own the first year, this is a great way to get caught up.

boardgame.name: There Once Were Dragons Compendium 3
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This accessory for There Once Were Dragons, the roleplaying game of epic fantasy action, introduces a wealth of new material to enrich your game:


10 new monsters, including Krakens, Kravs and Witch Fogs.
20 new uncommon, rare, exotic and legendary magical items, including the Blood Oracle belt, Primordial Song bow and Skysplitter battle axe.

boardgame.name: Exit Adventskalender: Die Jagd nach dem goldenen Buch
EXIT: Das Spiel – Adventskalender: Die Jagd nach dem goldenen Buch
Exit: The Game – Advent Calendar: The Hunt for the Golden Book
boardgame.description:
Oh no! Something terrible has happened: Santa Claus' golden book has disappeared! It contained a complete list of all the Christmas wishes. If the book isn't found by Christmas Eve, there will be nothing but sad faces around the tree on Christmas morning. It is up to you to save Christmas — and time is of the essence!

The thief's trail leads you to a remote mountain village. You quickly notice that something strange is afoot here...but what? And where has the golden book gone? You must find it, but let me tell you: Behind the doors of this village there are many surprises waiting for you!

Exit: The Game – Advent Calendar: The Hunt for the Golden Book is an EXIT game and a 24-part adventure story in one. To find the golden book, you must open a little calendar door every day. Behind each, you will find a new exciting puzzle, the solution of which will help you to move onto the next room. Only if you follow the clues and solve all 24 puzzles will you find the thief and the book...and save Christmas.

boardgame.name: TITechCorp Equipment Flyer #12
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you tired of your agents having inferior weapons?

Tired of your lackeys falling like flies to the superheroes of the world?

Tired of those dim-witted UNTIL agents having better equipment than your agents?

Then you have come to the right place here at TITechCorp we are dedicated to creating the best weapons, armor and other equipment money can buy.

So stop by today and pick up the latest blaster or force belt and get a jump on those pesky do-gooders.

And remember your satisfaction is guaranteed or we won’t see you again.
A new set of armor to give agents of any organization in Champions campaign includes Hero Designer files.

boardgame.name: Killer Bee
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

S.I.D. is short for Super-powered Individual Database. This is a database that various government agencies are starting to use to keep track of all the various villains and heroes. Over the last few years the number of super-powered individuals has skyrocketed.

S.I.D. Bulletin is a flyer that will highlight solo villains that have come on to the scene. The same care will be taken with their entry as with those in out S.I.D. Report. The known history and abilities all will be given.

This is a series of small products that will introduce new villains and heroes for you campaign.

This installment will introduce a new villain – Killer Bee

This individual that has created a suit that will shrink its wearer. He also can communicate with insects.

boardgame.name: Legend (No 1 - Oct 1986)
boardgame.description:
Adventure: Black Stone
D&D Translations
Swedish D&D Association

boardgame.name: Asian Monsters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beasts from the East

Asian Monsters is a 112-page DnD 5E monster book featuring over 90 incredible creatures drawn from the myths and legends of Asia. Researched and developed with a diverse team of authors, artists, and cultural consultants, you'll find an awesome array of enemies and allies from the folklore of Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Laos, Malaysia, Myanmar, Thailand, Tibet, and Vietnam, as well as nations of the western Pacific like Indonesia, Australia, and the Philippines, beautifully illustrated and ready to unleash in your DnD 5E campaign. From minor menaces like the kyeryong and kappa to gargantuan sea monsters and kaiju, restless dead like the gwishin, gaki, jiang-shi, and manananggal, fey kami and nats, celestial kirin and komainu, fiendish asuras and oni, you'll find killer creatures to challenge any hero!

boardgame.name: Hidden Dragon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Hidden Dragon, a group of level-5 adventurers learns about the sudden disappearance of farmers and commoners near Greensoil Forest. The locals are concerned and the authorities are at odds about how to react. There are growing rumors of dark ladies who roam the forest, they call them witches but who is to know whether that is true or not.

A friendly druid, Phil Rodrick wants to help. He knows the forest well and is acquainted with a satyr named Allastras. Both of them shall help the adventurers rid the forest of its nefarious disease. In the forest depths, a coven of three hags prepares to cast a ritual so foul it may destroy the forest and half the city. The only hope is that a group of valiant warriors stop the hags in time and save the day!

boardgame.name: Legend (No 2 - Dec 1986)
boardgame.description:
D&D Adventures
RuneQuest Adventure
Gambling Associations - Gothenburg

boardgame.name: Triton's Crown
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The party has survived the fierce strorm raging over Freeport when word of a shipwreck is discovered. Unfortunately, the wreck is the vessel that you were expecting a package from and it appears you will go under the waves to start your mission!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition rules D&D for the Filbar Campaign for four, fourth level adventurers and DM.

This adventure was offered at Gen Con 2019 and we had an amazing time with it.

boardgame.name: Schichtwechsel: Die Förderung liegt in deiner Hand
boardgame.description:
Over the past centuries, the Ruhr region in Germany has been shaped and dominated by coal mining. At the end of 2018, the last coal mine in Bottrop closed its doors, bringing to an end an era in the Ruhr region that is second to none.

The game Schichtwechsel takes up this theme and shows simplified typical areas around the coal mining in the Ruhr area of the 1950s. As a player and administrator of a coal mine, you experience an exciting competition and live through a piece of Ruhr Valley history. You bring coal and overburden from underground to the surface, let your miner go through a "shift at the colliery", produce coke, or build the typical colliery settlements.

A game of Schichtwechsel takes place over five rounds, and each round consists of three phases: The preparation phase in which, among other things, the amount of mined coal is determined; the action phase in which players use their action pieces wisely in turn; and a small end-of-round evaluation. After the fifth round is a final scoring. Schichtwechsel offers you many possibilities to get the best out of your coal mine in order to score as many victory points as possible at the end.

This game is the revised and improved version of the game Die lettze Zeche, which was created between June 2017 and March 2018 as a contribution of the games group Fair-Spielt of the Spielezentrum Herne to the funding project "GLÜCK AUF JUGEND". The RAG Foundation's sponsorship project honors the achievements of coal mining on the occasion of the coal phase-out and the closure of the last mines at the end of 2018.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: played once. no pets no smokers.

payment methods: (Bank transfer, Paypal or self pick up in our store.)
bank transfer to: name: spiele4us GmbH IBAN: DE12390400130111862900 BIC: COBADEFFXXX Institut:Commerzbank Aachen
Paypal to: service@spiele4us.de
Self-pickup at: spiele4us GmbH Roetgenbachstraße 2 52159 Roetgen Germany

Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 4 Spieldauer: 90 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 12+
SCHICHTWECHSEL - Die Förderung liegt in deiner Hand Wir schreiben das Jahr 1950. Nachkriegs-Deutschland im Wiederaufbau. Der Steinkohleabbau ist einer der wichtigsten Pfeiler für den wirtschaftlichen Aufschwung.
Als Besitzer einer von vier Zechen des Ruhrgebiets sorgst du für den reibungslosen Ablauf in deinem Betrieb: Leite Deine Kumpel geschickt durch ihre Schicht, organisiere den Abtransport der Kohle und die Veredelung in der Kokerei. Stelle außerdem sicher, dass Du auf Straße, Schiene und Kanal Deinen Mitstreitern voraus bist. Kurzum baue die produktivste Zechensiedlung und sichere Dir so das Ansehen als erfolgreichster Zechenbetrieb und durchlebe dabei ein Stück Ruhrgebietsgeschichte der 1950er Jahre.
Schichtwechsel ist ein strategisches Ruhrpott-Zechenspiel für 2-4 Kumpel. Eine Partie verläuft über 5 Runden, die wiederum aus 3 Phasen bestehen, in denen ihr den Zechenbetrieb vorbereitet (1), Aktionen durchführt, bis jeder gepasst hat (2), und eine der wechselnden Rundenkarten wertet (3), um Siegpunkte zu sammeln.
Den Auftakt jeder Runde bildet das Ziehen von Kohle- und Abraumwürfeln aus einem Beutel, die der Startspieler an alle Mitspieler verteilt. Mit den Würfeln beladet ihr die Loren eurer Zeche, bevor ihr eure Aktionen und Bergleute clever einsetzt, um Siegpunkte zu erhalten. Siegpunkte gibt es durch den Verkauf von Koks, durch das Erreichen der Zielfelder der drei Verkehrswege Straße, Schiene und Kanal, und durch das Absolvieren der Bergmannschicht mit euren Bergleuten. Verliert weder den Pegel eures Grubenwassers noch eure Mitstreiter aus dem Blick, denn sie werden auf der Jagd nach Siegpunkten die begrenzten Baugruben und begehrten Kokereiplätze nutzen, um euch den Sieg streitig zu machen.
Ein reibungsloser Ablauf und gutes Timing sind in deiner Zeche entscheidend. Besitzt du genug planerisches Geschick, um deinen Bergmann als Ersten in den verdienten Feierabend zu entlassen und den Wettlauf um die erfolgreichste Zeche im Revier zu gewinnen?
Inhalt: 1 Spielplan 6 Rundenkarten 1 Startspiel-Marker 4 Spielertableaus “Zechen” 22 Aktionskarten 4 Aktionskarten in Spielerfarbe 7 Auswahlplättchen 2 Abdeckmarker “Bergmann-Schicht” für 2 oder 3 Spieler 2 Abdeckmarker “Kokerei” für 2 oder 3 Spieler 50 Werkzeug-Marker 50 Siegpunkte “1” 20 Siegpunkte “5” 15 Siegpunkte “15” 12 Münzen 4 Bergleute (je 1 in Spielerfarbe) 4 Spieleraktionssteine (je 1 in Spielerfarbe) 12 Spielerscheiben (je 3 in Spielerfarbe) 20 Zechenhäuser (je 5 in Spielerfarbe) 44 Koks (je 11 in Spielerfarbe) 5 Grubenwasseranzeiger (je 1 pro Spieler + 1 für den Beutel) 20 weiße Aktionssteine 40 Kohle 36 Abraum 8 Förderturmplättchen (je 2 in Spielerfarbe) mit Fuß 1 Stoffbeutel 1 Spielanleitung 1 Wertungsblock)
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE
